ARABIC: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ ٱلرِّيحَ تَجْرِى بِأَمْرِهِۦ رُخَآءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So We subjected the wind to him to blow at his command, softly, wherever he directed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So we subjugated the wind to his service which carried his merchandise wheresoever he wished;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We subjected the wind to him, so that it blew gently at his bidding, wherever he directed it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We made the wind subservient to him, to blow gently wherever he desired at his command
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We therefore gave the wind under his control, moving steadily by his command wherever he wished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, We subjected to him the wind; it blew gently by his order wherever he willed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then We made the wind subservient to him; it made his command to run gently wherever he desired,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So We subjected to him the wind, that ran at his commandment, softly, wherever he might light on,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So We made the wind subservient unto him, setting fair by his command whithersoever he intended.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then We subjected the wind to his power, so that it blew gently, at his behest, wherever he willed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then We subjected to him the wind: it ran gently by his command withersoever he directed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So We disposed the wind for him, blowing softly wherever he intended by his command,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then We subjected the wind to his power, to flow gently to his order, Whithersoever he willed,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So, We subjected to him the wind, it blew gently to his order whithersoever he willed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So We subjected the wind to him, so that it ran softly by his command wherever he wished;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So We placed the wind at his service, blowing gently by his command, wherever he directed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:36] So We disposed for him the wind, which blew softly, gently, at his command wherever he intended.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So We made the wind subservient unto him) after that, (setting fair) setting gently (by his command) and it is said: by Allah's command (whithersoever he intended) wherever he wished.
